question: Show how many students have achieved each developmental milestone
sql_query1: SELECT MilestoneRecords.physicalMilestones, Count(*) as Pupil_Count FROM MileStoneRecords
sql_query2: SELECT MilestoneRecords.cognitiveMilestones, Count(*) as Pupil_Count FROM MileStoneRecords
sql_query3: SELECT MilestoneRecords.physicalMilestones, cognitiveMilestones, Count(*) as Pupil_Count FROM MileStoneRecords
interpretation1: List the physical milestones and the number of students that have achieved it.
interpretation2: List the cognitive milestones and the number of students that have achieved it.
interpretation3: List the physical and cognitive milestones and the number of students that have achieved it.
sql_query_general: SELECT MilestoneRecords.Developmental_Milestones, Count(*) as Pupil_Count FROM MileStoneRecords

question: Show developmental milestones and child's age in order of the age
sql_query1: SELECT MilestoneRecords.physicalMilestones, MilestoneRecords.childAge FROM MileStoneRecords ORDER BY MilestoneRecords.childAge
sql_query2: SELECT MilestoneRecords.cognitiveMilestones, MilestoneRecords.childAge FROM MileStoneRecords ORDER BY MilestoneRecords.childAge
sql_query3: SELECT MilestoneRecords.physicalMilestones, cognitiveMilestones, MilestoneRecords.childAge FROM MileStoneRecords ORDER BY MilestoneRecords.childAge
interpretation1: show physical milestones and child age in age ascending order
interpretation2: show cognitive milestones and child age in age ascending order
interpretation3: show physical and cognitive milestones and child age in age ascending order
sql_query_general: SELECT MilestoneRecords.Developmental_Milestones, MilestoneRecords.childAge FROM MileStoneRecords ORDER BY MilestoneRecords.childAge
